page.title: 01Ashford Carbonell
page.content: The area being looked at by Ashford Carbonell School lies to the south of the county of Shropshire.It is a peaceful rural area with no major industrial development.Ashford Carbonell is an old village with the church dating back to Norman times, a village school of the 19th century, and village hall of the early 20th century. The area has changed over the centuries,but only slowly.Many of the cider orchards and smaller fields bounded by hedges have been replaced by larger fields of wheat,barley and grass.However most of the land is still down to farming. The housing is a mixture of very old,old,not so old and new,which has meant that the population of the area has increased over the last 20 years. Many people would consider this area as a good place to live.
